intro: Centella montana var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved centella, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its creeping growth habit and small, opposite leaves. Due to its medicinal properties, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its potential skin-healing benefits.
